subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Mario Matt of Austria won the men’s World Cup slalom Sunday, and Ted Ligety and Bode Miller of the United States failed to finish.Matt, a slalom specialist, finished with a total time of 1 minute 48.45 seconds at the Kuonisbaergli course in Adelboden, Switzerland, a tenth of a second ahead of his teammate Benjamin Raich.Ligety had tied for third in the first run in soft snow conditions. He straddled a gate and went out in the second run. Miller made an error at one of the first gates, then lost his footing a second time and failed to finish the first run.Jimmy Cochran was the only American to finish. He came in eighth, 1.27 seconds behind the leader.
